## {{< fa lightbulb >}} Concepts

#### [Microinterations](https://bootcamp.uxdesign.cc/8-huge-ui-design-trends-to-watch-out-for-in-2024-2026-9f5bd243de2f)

Notice how the 'Microinteraction' above turns a shade darker as you hover over it before clicking to be redirected to a website that I've just visited? According to several articles that I had read, these can be game-changers when it comes to user experience. These subtle design elements provide users with instant feedback, which generously helps users in keeping tabs on their actions. It also helps in interface comprehension while guiding users through tasks.
